org.mini2Dx.core.graphics

Interface Pixmap

  • All Superinterfaces:
    org.mini2Dx.gdx.utils.Disposable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    LibgdxPixmap

    public interface Pixmap
extends org.mini2Dx.gdx.utils.Disposable

      Draws a rectangle outline starting at x, y extending by width to the right and by height downwards (y-axis points downwards) using the current color.

                   int y,
                   int width,
                   int height)
        Draws a rectangle outline starting at x, y extending by width to the right and by height downwards (y-axis points downwards) using the current color.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate
        y - The y coordinate
        width - The width in pixels
        height - The height in pixels

      • drawPixmap

                int x,
                int y)
        Draws an area from another Pixmap to this Pixmap.
        Parameters:
        pixmap - The other Pixmap
        x - The target x-coordinate (top left corner)
        y - The target y-coordinate (top left corner)

      • drawPixmap

        void drawPixmap(Pixmap pixmap,
                int x,
                int y,
                int srcx,
                int srcy,
                int srcWidth,
                int srcHeight)
        Draws an area from another Pixmap to this Pixmap.
        Parameters:
        pixmap - The other Pixmap
        x - The target x-coordinate (top left corner)
        y - The target y-coordinate (top left corner)
        srcx - The source x-coordinate (top left corner)
        srcy - The source y-coordinate (top left corner);
        srcWidth - The width of the area from the other Pixmap in pixels
        srcHeight - The height of the area from the other Pixmap in pixels

      • drawPixmap

        void drawPixmap(Pixmap pixmap,
                int srcx,
                int srcy,
                int srcWidth,
                int srcHeight,
                int dstx,
                int dsty,
                int dstWidth,
                int dstHeight)
        Draws an area from another Pixmap to this Pixmap. This will automatically scale and stretch the source image to the specified target rectangle. Use setFilter(PixmapFilter) to specify the type of filtering to be used (nearest neighbour or bilinear).
        Parameters:
        pixmap - The other Pixmap
        srcx - The source x-coordinate (top left corner)
        srcy - The source y-coordinate (top left corner);
        srcWidth - The width of the area from the other Pixmap in pixels
        srcHeight - The height of the area from the other Pixmap in pixels
        dstx - The target x-coordinate (top left corner)
        dsty - The target y-coordinate (top left corner)
        dstWidth - The target width
        dstHeight - the target height

        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate
        y - The y coordinate
        width - The width in pixels
        height - The height in pixels

        y1 - The y-coordinate of vertex 1
        x2 - The x-coordinate of vertex 2
        y2 - The y-coordinate of vertex 2

        y3 - The y-coordinate of vertex 3

        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate
        y - the y-coordinate
        color - the color.

      • getPixel

        int getPixel(int x,
             int y)
        Returns the 32-bit RGBA8888 value of the pixel at x, y. For Alpha formats the RGB components will be one.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate
        y - The y-coordinate
        Returns:
        The pixel color in RGBA8888 format.

      • getPixels

        byte[] getPixels()
        Creates a new byte array holding the pixel data. For the format Alpha each value is encoded as a byte. For the format LuminanceAlpha the luminance is the first byte and the alpha is the second byte of the pixel. For the formats RGB888 and RGBA8888 the color components are stored in a single byte each in the order red, green, blue (alpha). For the formats RGB565 and RGBA4444 the pixel colors are stored in shorts in machine dependent order.
        Returns:
        A new byte array holding the pixel data.

      • getWidth

        int getWidth()
        Returns:
        The width of the Pixmap in pixels.

      • getHeight

        int getHeight()
        Returns:
        The height of the Pixmap in pixels.
